Reviews.Title: “Its exactly what my rating says, VERY AVERAGE!”
Reviews.Author: josephcj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Mall of Emirates, therefore it scores well on location. When you look at the hotel from the outside there's absolutely nothing to get excited about. The lobby is average again. The service overall is quite poor. They have a restaurant in the lobby, and sometimes the whole lobby smells when they serve highly aromatic food from the Indian subcontinent. And that's not very nice to walk into. There's an Indian restaurant on the ground floor and due to the poor air ventilation system, its just very over bearing with the smell of Indian food. I mean I'm from India, and trust me when I say that this is not how it is any Indian restaurant back home or any where else that I've been to. So the breakfast is served in this restaurant and its mostly Indian, so those who like an Indian breakfast will be al right I guess, but others who's prefer a continental breakfast like me, aren't going to have too much to choose from. The room that I was in was very large, it was clean like the rest of the hotel. It had a mini bar and refrigerator and no coffee maker though. They didn't have an iron in the room, so I had to call it in and it wasn't of very good quality. The bathroom is clean and reasonably sized with a bath tub, nothing to complain about. The booking was made by company and hence I got a really cheap deal. So at the price I paid, it was good. Otherwise they charge about AED 450 for double occupancy I think. We got nearly 50% off on that price. Overall its not a place that I'd recommend unless you want to stay close to the Mall of Emirates and go cheap. Conclusion: the location is good, room is big and clean, but the service is not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Alec Romania”
Reviews.Author: mircea a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 days and: -location close Mall of Emirates, metro, 15 minutes walk -room big, clean, comfortable; -staff frienly, check-in fast -breakfest monoton, but dinner good I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur is a big word for a poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: TC_On_Tour
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest from the beginning; the room was big, clean and comfortable, for some people that's the be all and end all for most hotels, but there were far too many little inconveniences with this 3 star hotel for it to get a positive review. Let's kick off with some of them: - Inconsistent hot water - this has to be a hotel's cardinal sin to break. Particularly annoying because the bathroom was clean, contemporary and rather smart - Either nonexistent or excellent internet - although free (regrettably in years of travelling, free internet is like massive neon sign suggesting a hotel is decidedly average) - Particularly unhelpful but very smiley staff - I rang reception to ask if they had a Nokia charger, something hotels must have by the million. The straight up response of “No” suggests the bloke answering the phone gave absolutely no care what so ever - Some replacement tea and coffee would have been a nice touch too! The sports bar is a bit dingy with a distinct lack of broadcast sports, but that's not the end of the world because the Ramada hotel next door has an excellent sports bar which made the one in the Grandeur look especially ropey. Overall the Grandeur is a very average hotel that annoyingly could be very good if they focused a little bit more on the smaller things and service. It would be wrong to say the hotel is bad, but given the choice I would rather pay a few extra quid and stay somewhere a bit more established, the Ramada hotel next door for example.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: nishneel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and the price was very reasonable, the room was very spacious to fit one infant bed, one couch and a queen size bed. It's about 1.5km from mall of emirates so walking it out in summer will be difficult, but winter is fine. Ther's a nice restaurant and night club on the ground flr but not that noisy, did not disturb our kids.The staff was friendly and kept the place clean. We did not try the restaurant but it was booked for parties most of the times. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel close to the Mall of the Emirates”
Reviews.Author: enggeol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of my client as it was near the laboratory I had to visit for 3 days and was very reasonable for the area. The room I had 114 was very spacious, clean and comfortable and well away from the venue that is used in the hotel for parties etc so the only noise I heard was the light traffic noise in the evenings and mornings as the room was at the front of the hotel. WiFi is not free and cost 7 dirhams/hour but note that if you ask for this to be put on the bill you are billed 15 dirhams! The buffet restaurant in the reception was good value even thuogh it went up form 40 to 50 dirhams whilst I was there but do not bother with the other restaurant, seriously overpriced and no atmosphere. The buffet breakfast was in this room and had a reasonable buffet selection which was OK for me. The hotel staff were generally helpful and attentive. Rated very good based on value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nillem
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, and GREAT beds, the rooms are big and is within walking distance of one of the big malls (i dont remember which one). The breakfast, however, is a bit boring.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Itcyfeet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. Check in was quick but unfortunately they gave us a room that was occupied we were then given another room but moved again after 10 minutes, not great after a long journey and arriving at midnight. Everything else about the hotel was fine. Good location next to the Emirates mall and metro. Large clean rooms with good bathrooms and very comfortable beds.Adequate roof top pool with pool towels. Extremely pleasant staff. Very good value for money. The bonus for us was ladies evening (Tues) in the sports bar where women were offered free glasses of wine. Would I stay again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Not so good staff”
Reviews.Author: RUSH2
Reviews.Content: hotel location, room size and comfort of bed all great. bathroom really smelled bad even though it was clean. staff aren't up to the standards, whether at check in or even room service (where the server insisted on shaking my hand- was not comfortable!). dont expect it to be serene as the hotel is bustling and loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor check in/check out management”
Reviews.Author: mpoloAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is walking distance to Mall of Emirates and Metro station. This enable one to move around Dubai easily using the metro for shopping, visiting restaurants and attractions and avoiding traffic and at cheaper cost. However, due to lack of staff we have to wait for more than 2 hours to get our rooms which was pre-booked. In fact we went to the mall while waiting for the rooms and when we came back, we have to wait again to get the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not suited for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Ashokrao78
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days. locating the hotel was an ordeal with the map on their website not very accurate and the hotel staff not able to guide us properly. Stay and food was decent. However, not a very comfortable stay for the business traveller. Good one if you are on a holiday. The hotel does not provide some basic stuff like newspapers in the morning and a TV with morning news at the buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Batman2727
Reviews.Content: Food they serve was excellent , they helped me in preparing food which is out of their menu but food is some what expensive, good service , good location behind the mall of Emirates . Front managers were helpful on all ocassions . Only one problem i faced is Taxi drivers dont know the location of the hotel and more people don kno this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Was better when it was new, but still very good.”
Reviews.Author: steven_nagoya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Dec 2008 when it was very new. I have seen it has not been kept in like-new condition. However, the hotel is very reasonable, and its location close to the Mall of the Emirates makes it more attractive. The rooms are large, and kept in very good shape. The bed is huge and comfortable; not too soft and not hard. The bathroom was clean and the shower water power was good. What I didn't like was the atmosphere, and the loud sports bar on the first floor. The price of the restaurant was higher than expected, so I went to a local shop and restaurant and just bought dinner and supplies and brought them to my room. Its about a 10 minute walk to the Mall of the Emirates, so its very good for that sort of thing. And the Metro is at the Mall, so getting around is easy. Internet is pay-as-you-go and not too badly priced. I bought the 1 hour for 15 dhms. The whole day internet access costs 70dhms. The pool is on the roof and not bad. I didn't try the fitness center but looked in and the equipment looked alright. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: zizo37
Reviews.Content: Some staff very nice like the philippino and moroccan girls in the reception, some staff not so helpfull. Rooms spacius and modern, good selection of TV channels, small but nic swimming pool and Jacuzzi if u dont mind the constructions around, nice small Sauna, resturants are ok. Generally great value for less than 300AED night.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Pricing - Avg. Quality”
Reviews.Author: irlundee
Reviews.Content: Even though I got an internet deal, it was not a 5 star like they claim. Dead hotel, dead area, dust - dirt and construction around, close to a large mall, not a good thing, why? It is crawling with prostitution and isn't a nice place despite its glamour. Far from real shopping districts like gold souk or old dubai and deira - plenty of big malls in the West, don't travel to the middle east to go to the body shop! Rooms small, noisy, no wifi even though website at the time, claimed free wifi, spoke to manager, wasn't accomodating. Fitness centre, most machines not turned on! Pool - very small Don't stay at this hotel unless you get it for $70 or less a night.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO EXPERIENCE PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: batbank
Reviews.Content: the room is ok, but the workers are slow and rude. not to mention that I have to recharge the hotel key everytime I'm out. Sports bar is crap. they don't refill the breakfast when the food is finished. The basement carpark stinks. Construction everywhere, left and right of the building. Can't get a pretty sleep. You'll be waken by the sound of people doing construction as early as 6AM. The construction guys will always stare at you when you're at the pool like you're some alien creature. Everytime you had a guest to come along they will chase you like you're hiring a prostitute. Very very uncomfortable stay at the hotel. nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeurggghhh”
Reviews.Author: fuel2noise
Reviews.Content: Ghastly: In the middle of a dusty building site, construction noise continuously and poor sound insulation. Check in took almost an hour despite prior internet booking. Early check in was the advert, our rooms weren't ready till 1600! Rooms were adequate. Consierge and car parking un reliable (asked for car to be brought up for 0330 - found the car attendents asleep, had to do it ourselves on the morning). Food in restaurants tasteless, service (although there seem to be hundreds of people) is poor and slow. Breakfast (inclusive deal) tatsteless and horrible. Gym excellent, although overlooked by contruction workers in next building, so girls get continuously oggled and jeered. Swimming pool adequate, small and everywhere covered in dust. The bar - well indescribable really - think a smokey unlit store room and you get the picture - not like it is photographed on the flyers or on the internet!!! You have been warned! Overall: give it a miss, nothing like described on the internet, it has the feeling of 'the last bus left town hours ago', about it. I read other reviews that are more positive and wonder if I've been to the same hotel??? Utterly dreadful experience overall

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and spacious room, close to mall of Emirates...however lacked some basic complimentary facilities”
Reviews.Author: LillyBu
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Dubai at 5:30am in the morning, having travelled 7 hours on a very uncomfortable flight. The check in time for the hotel was supposed to be at 2pm, and no rooms were available at that time, so we slept on the lobby sofa. The receptionist did their best to arrange a room for us, and we were able to check-in at 8:30am, so we got plenty of rest. This was the biggest room we stayed at during our 6 weeks trip around Asia, so it was a pleasant surprise that our final hotel offered us a very comfortable room. However, this was the only hotel which did not offer us any complimentary water or coffee making services. This was a little disappointing, considering that even the 2 stars hotels we stayed at during our travel offered these facilities. Overall, this was a very comfortable hotel (ignoring the entrance and exterior of the building)...It was close to the Mall of Emirates and Ski Dubai (they are in the same place!) Don't be fooled by the hotel tour operator who will try to sell you a tour to Ski Dubai, you can walk their in less than 15mins, or I would suggest to everyone - take a cab! Its only 10 AED...its too hot to walk, even at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and away from from the traffic”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed_Omar
Reviews.Content: it was actually perfect as i never ever thought that I could stay in Dubai for 6 nights in a high-season-period (December) with such a great daily rate of $100. Every thing was great; location (behind Mall of the Emirates away from the jam and rush Dubai is known by), staff, value (good prices in Dubai), cleanliness (the hotel opened in October '08), and interior design (cozy and modern). Noteworthy that it's location can be very convienient for business travellers as well. It is accessible from many sides of Dubai and MOE, Dubai Internet City, Dubai Marina, and Jumierah Road are short ride by car. paring could be the drawback but no worries as car parking service is avilable at the concierge and for free. Mohammed K. OMar Saudi Arabia, Riyadh

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: manish2001
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, location behind mall of emirates, convineance for shopping, excellent staff service, good reasturants, excellent breakfast menu, very good size of rooms

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: milochoco
Reviews.Content: I had a training with colleagues in Al Bashir and we were lodged in Grandeur. Although in the middle of construction sites, and a bit difficult to locate initialy, the service was excellent. We enjoyed the health room and the roof-top swimming pool. The rooms were neat. The staff was courteous and always around to help. The breakfast was lovely and Indian restaurant superb. It was generally a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: sarahcanada35
Reviews.Content: Beside the noises from surrounding constructions, we got stollen , we left some money in the safe and we forgot to lock it back(door looks shut even when it was not locked) and when we complains there excuse after 10 days from leaving the hotel is you should not leave unloked, we were not looking to get our money but at least for them to reassure us that they caught the thief and its a safe hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money but difficult to locate!”
Reviews.Author: fatbuttons
Reviews.Content: Overall this budget hotel is excellent value - it's in the middle of a building site, but so is most of Dubai However it was difficult to find taxi drivers who knew it, which made some trips quite expensive! Ask Reception for a map showing Grandeur location before you step out of the door! Also worth organising hotel pick up at the airport or you could spend a week driving around Dubai looking for your accommodation. One can just about walk to Mall of the Emirates, cutting across a couple of construction areas - it takes about 15 minutes. Otherwise there is nothing in the immediate locality and with prior knowledge would have booked nearer The Creek or Downtown Dubai - there's building work there too but more chance of finding restaurants. In fact by thed time one has taken taxis for a few days, on the face of it a hotel that seems slightly dearer would not cost more. The new light railway will help when it opens Autumn 2009. Hotel a little bleak and cheerless, though staff mostly polite and helpful. Would not stay there again - but then not sure that we'd visit Dubai again as a week was enough. Recommend Big Bus Tour for first couple of days as it gives a real flavour of the area - can pick this up at Mall of the Emirates. Expensive (Blue tour of the coast, and Red tour of the city came to about £40 per person) but really worth every dhiram.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: shazzasheffield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 13 nights in the granduer hotel.The hotel was very clean, very friendly staff and the breakfast excellent choice, continental, full english, fresh fruit ,cereal.The Indian restaurant was good too and very reasonably priced, watch out for the price of the alchohol tho very very expensive, the water in the hotel £5 for half ltr bottle Location ideal if you're a shopaholic 10 mims from mall of Emirates, 10 - 15 mins in a cab to beach cost around £6 sterling, Marina 10 mins in taxi again around £6.A must to see the Atlantis hotel allthough very expensive to visit the aquarium £30, and well worth a trip to the new Dubai mall, the fountains amazing and its free to see the sharks in the aquarium. The only down side of our visit was the building work that was going off at either side of the Granduer. We new this was happening but didn't know that the workmen started work at 6.00am till 7.00pm, and as the hotel has a roof top pool you felt uncomfortable them gazing at you.atleast we got an early morning wakeup calll every day so didn't miss breakfast.. Overall nice hotel and will be good when the buildings next door are finished.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: SusanaMCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had an awful stay at the Grandeur due to the unberable noise from the construction going on right next door to the hotel from both sides of the building. They start at 4 or 5am in the morning and one night, they went all night working with a full crew, a huge crane (came to less than 10 ft from our window), dropping/moving materials etc. We tried everything to get some sleep, ear plugs which the airline had given us, we got sleeping pills, nothing worked, the noise was too loud. In fact decided to cut our stay shorter because of this situation. The manager, Mahendy was no help at all. He was rude and unacommodating refused to give us any reduction on our bill, moreover, he ignored our plea and left us at the desk dissapearing into his office. We intend to pursue this matter with our credit card company, seeking some sort of discount for not having able to sleep a SINGLE night there. It ruined our otherwise good vacation. The only thing they offered to do, which was a joke, was to move us to another room but when I asked to "see" the room to make sure it would be away from the noise, the night manager told me that construction was also taking place on the other side of the building and that all rooms were exposed to the same noise. This matter should have been brought up when we made the reservation with bookings.com, had we read the Trip Advisor's guest reviews prior to making the reservation we would have never gone there. We are now planning our next trip and the first thing I did was to check out guests reviews before making reservations. I think that is the way to go. I would not advise anyone to stay there unless you have serious hearing problems! See pics attached, we took lots of them, you can "see" what me and other guests are taking about. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: KathyKinshasa
Reviews.Content: Travel agent had done her job. Booking confirmed breakfast included. When I arrived at the hotel at 3 AM they told my reservation only started the next. 1/ they said there were only suites available which wasn't true after checking the next mornig. There were standard rooms available. I paid extra 2/ I had cancel the two last nights which I did 4 days ahaed. They charged me for those two nights. Didn't want to hear anything. 3/ Breakfast was normally included in the price. They told me when giving me my final bill it wasn't. 4/ When making the reservation they didn"t tell it was going to be very noisy since buildings are being constructed all day and night long. 5/ People at the front desk were very unpleasant 6/ they also charge a lot for a very very bad internet connection. Please stay away, they give you one price and in the end you pay almost double. Not recommandable

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: ThePheonix
Reviews.Content: Not great al all. Was on business budget so not the kind of place I would choose to stay. First room I had (311) overlooked a building site which started work 0700 the next morning. The noise was terrible. Spent ages trying to change rooms, they even tried to charge for an upgrade! It was not until I threatened to check out that I was moved (316) which was better but overlooked the road. The ‘sports bar’ is a horrible little room with no atmosphere and a poor drinks selection. Restaurant was OK. Breakfast not too bad and the one evening meal I had was fine. The rooms themselves were a fairley good standard. Not one of the taxi drivers I used during the stay knew where this hotel was – if you are going to stay here pick up a few of the leaflets that advertise the ‘sports bar’ to give to taxi drivers as there is a location map on the back. I would strongly recommend paying a bit more and booking a better hotel in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “beter than median but not wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: burakOman
Reviews.Content: this 9th of december i gone dubai and 4 nights i stayed this hotel.so nice hotel for decoration and very clean..everything is new and nice because its new hotel..for hotels good maybe but not wonderfull... i wanna say some negative things.you shall remember;near to hotel contruction on going and that side has a lot of construction..taxi drivers dont know the hotel you must describe the place... but personnel is very friendly and ggood relation...

HotelInfo.Name: Grandeur Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Barsha First (Behind the Mall of Emirates) | PO Box 282429, Dubai 49521, United Arab Emirates
